												This mod is a gem. Hell i wasnt even a fan of the whole zombie genre when i tried this game out of curiosity five years ago but it quickly won me over thanks to its gameplay and atmosphere. Zombos can also infect you which really adds to the tension since it creates a climate of suspicion among the survivors.  Most of the official maps are well designed and interesting. The character models are well made too and all have their own "personality" and dialogue lines which is pretty cool.Last but not least, there is a really nice variety of weapons, including several melees. There is also a barricade system that can help you to hold off the undead. I should also mention the weapon and ammo management system. Guns and ammo slow you down so hoarding ammo is not an option. The weapon/ammo weight plus a fatigue bar adds to the realism and makes being a team player an absolute necessity.If you are looking for a fun, teamwork oriented zombie survival game, give it a try. Chances are you wont be disappointed. And remember, its FREE. :)

If You're Reading This Now, Install This Game And Play It. You Won't Regret It.Ah, ZPS. Words cannot describe my deep love for this true gem of a game. I started playing ZPS around early 2008 on my old account, and every second of it was a blast. The atmosphere, the frantic teamwork, the soundtrack and the gunplay was once the pinnacle of 2007-era Source multiplayer. The rush of joy at your first survivor/zombie kill. The great relief of surviving a horde, only to be faced with the overwhelming pressure of being the last survivor on your team. All of this combined and much, much more gave ZPS it's once shining luster.Skip forward almost 8 years later, and ZPS is more-or-less dead. The average number of dedicated players is abysmal, developer support is non-existant, and the only thing keeping ZPS barely alive is the community. It truly is a tragedy, how much has changed in such a short time, and all for the worst.Contagion tried (and failed) to preserve the original beauty of ZPS. But with almost all of the ZPS team gone to places unkown, the true spirit of ZPS is in risk of being lost forever.Though there have been petitions on popular websites such as change.org, all we have recieved so far are empty promises from a struggling dev team. Unless something changes, and fast, the crumbling foundation of the ZPS community could very well collapse, and more quickly than we think.Therefore I pay my final ode to ZPS. Chances are, come back in a few years time, and ZPS will practically be unheard of. Hell, there may not even be a store page left to view any more. Or reviews such as this.All we, what remains of the ZPS community can do, is continue to play ZPS in the vain hope that our meager efforts will keep ZPS alive. All we can do is spread the word to new players. All we can do is build groups and servers. All we can do is demand updates and a little bit of TLC for ZPS, even though it's bound to never happen in our lifetimes.Therefore I plead you one more time; If you are new to the concept of ZPS and do not play it, click that green install button right now and launch it up. You will not regret it, trust me.That is all I have to say. Thank you for your time.

Zombie Panic: Source - a dying, buggy, yet fun game.Rather than let the game's community affect my perspective on this game like most others, I will be basing this review on the game ONLY.Originating in December of 2007 and originally being a Source Mod for Half Life 2 Deathmatch, this game is on its final days of living unfortunately. It runs on the old Source Base 2007. It's very thrilling to play alongside your friends and have them fall to the undead, turning against you and eventually feasting on your flesh (hopefully not!).Official Game Trailer


YouTube™ Video: Official Zombie Panic Source Trailer 

			Views: 88,706		

			Official Zombie Panic Source Trailer		

Description:The game is quite easy to get started in, but has the typical motto of "hard to master". It is difficult for starting players, but you get better at the game rather quickly, so do not feel discouraged if you lose a lot in the beginning! Find the right people to play with and they'll be glad to help you out! Some servers offer modifications such as models, trails, stats, infection cure, and more. The community is slowly deteriorating away; a significantly lower amount of players play each day, but you'll currently find four to six servers with a decent amount of people.Teamwork can be very critical depending on the map, such as requiring zombies to work together in specific strategies or survivors sticking together to heighten the chance of survival, although teamwork is usually not present due to poor communication or stubborness. When survivors die they turn into zombies, having the new goal of having to kill every survivor.Survivors, depending on the map, must either survive, kill all zombies, or complete objectives, which usually ends in escaping the map.Zombies must attempt to kill all the survivors before running out of time, lives, or the survivors reaching a point. Visuals and Lag Compensation:Visuals are what you would expect from a Source mod on the 2007 engine, running Direct X 9. There are numerous visual bugs and glitches, especially from minimizing and re-opening your game, but most of them are minor and won't disturb the game too much. Shadows and flashlights will show through several surfaces and walls. Hitboxes may also show through surfaces and can be damaged, although this is uncommon.Lag compensation is quite horrid (zombies can hit you five feet away due to extended hit range) and the hit boxes can be also occasionally. Players can have the same ping and one player will still be able to have lag compensation advantage. When zombies use their lunge ability (temporary speed boost), they almost always get extended hit range. Zombies may hit you even without looking at you. Occasionally when attempting to kill a survivor using a melee weapon on you, when you get hit they'll have some invisible forcefield around them preventing you from moving closer. Even on LAN these things will occur. I've found the lag compensation to be the most bothersome when trying to enjoy the game. There's also the infamous corner peeking registry. When you quickly peek around a corner and shoot a zombie your shot will not be registered because their hitboxes are still behind the wall but their model is showing.Characters and Weapons:There are up to six survivors to choose from, all with their own unique voices and quotes, ranging from a waitress with weird breast implants to a bald police officer. They also have their own zombie counterpart. Voice acting is quite comical but sounds generic and awkward at times, such as the waitress having an odd moan when she attacks. Survivors can use voice commands as mentioned, "panic" which gives you a temporary stamina boost,  a flashlight, and many other actions. The starting zombie will become a zombie known as "The Carrier". The carrier is basically the "alpha zombie", having more strength, health, and the ability to infect and "roar".There are weapons of course, and unique melee weapons too. Some weapons include rifles, shotguns, chairs, IED explosives, grenades, and even props themselves. Several of the weapons are unbalanced, but that statement is highly subjective. Accuracy and recoil are pretty meaningless on most weapons so you can jump around like a maniac and land headshots. Two melee weapons are missing models and use the crowbar model instead. It would have been nice if console cvars were included to customize crosshairs like in most Source games; the ZPS crosshair is pretty obtrusive to me, because its dot blocks a lot of heads I try to shoot. The crosshair also becomes larger if you use lower resolutions, which can be a problem for people that like using low res like myself. Modes and Maps:Modes you can play are objective mode (ZPO), survival mode (ZPS), team arena (ZPA), and hardcore (ZPH). An additional modded mode called Deathmatch (ZPD) is present, which pits survivors versus survivors. There are also some deathrun maps. Maps are very unique and creative, some requiring imaginative barricades or dodging giant blocks fired at you, adding to the endless replayability factor. Some maps may be well balanced, or very survivor/zombie sided, as well as grotesque-looking maps with poor designs and numerous bugs, which is usually the norm now.Quite an enjoyable game to play with friends, albeit the small playerbase of today. It's free too, so it's worth a try.Pros and ConsPros:- A large variety of maps, good and bad.- Simple, creepy soundtrack.- Co-op and teamwork is the main focus of this game for both zombies and survivors.- Easy to get started in- Simple, intuitive voice commands.- Chill community.- A massive update by the new dev team will be coming later this year; you can check it out on the hub.Cons:- Numerous visual glitches and map exploits.- Extremely bad netcode and hit registry.- Rounds can become tediously delayed when fewer players are alive.- Outdated, buggy code.Replayability factor: Very high.My overall score of this game/Source mod is: 7.5/10Note: this review will be updated once the major update is released.

												Notice: The Contagion developers seem to be so busy with their retail game that ZPS' updating has slowed to a crawl, if it's even being updated anymore. I would really, really like for a developer or two to give evidence that I'm wrong, as I still love ZPS and would prefer that it does not befall the same fate as it's GoldSrc brother, Zombie Panic.TL;DR: As much as I like it, I simply cannot recommend any new players to try this game out. The difficulty curve at this point in time is frustrating for beginners, as a great majority of the community left is veterans. Development has practically ceased in favor of Contagion. ZPS is actively dying. Balance needs fixing, badly.Ladies and gentlemen, Zombie Panic Source. This was a great mod back in its prime. I would go so far as to say it was one of the best, if not THE best, multiplayer SMods of its time. An update on February 11, 2011 (if i recall correctly) made the game even more difficult by "fixing" knockback, though this made things even harder for Survivors when attempting to win. It has not been "re-broken" since, adding to the steep difficulty curve for humans.Was one of the best SMods of it's time. Not anymore.It's core idea is this: two teams, humans and zombies, are 100% player-controlled, battling for either the sake of humanity or for the world to be a bit more overrun with undead. Unlike Contagion, there is no AI here. None. Every single moving entity is controlled by a living, human being. It also is unlike Left 4 Dead in the sense that humans are not able to take tons and tons of damage; with normal health and no armor, four scratches (3 from the Carrier) and you're dead. Meanwhile, Zombies literally eat bullets for breakfast, and it's gonna take a lot to their face for them to fall. This game encourages teamwork, but it is not mandatory, meaning you could totally be a jerk and leave your fellow survivors to die and still win. That being said, there's the chance that they will come back with a vengeance, making your job of surviving much harder than before. Every bullet and survivor counts.Unfortunately, in a game like this, balance is always an issue, and right now there is a lack thereof. When knockback was fixed on zombies, instead of bullets pushing them back, zombies are "slowed down" instead, and sometimes this mechanic doesn't even work properly. What's worse is that smart zombies can actually power through the sluggish spells, maiming survivors even as they panic to get away.It has been over a year now since the last update. Contagion, the successor to this mod, is not looking much better. The community is dying, servers becoming more and more empty by the minute. Some groups do attempt to keep it alive, like the Specialist League, but it only does so much for the game. ZPS desparately needs an update or two, but there's no indicator in sight, as made clear by game news updates for Contagion in the Zombie Panic Source feed.On a more personal note, ZPS is the reason I found Steam in the first place--that's why it sucks so much to see it die.

This game is amazing!Till this day it is still my favorite survivor/zombie game of all time.So what makes this game so good? It features fryingpans and chairs as melee weapons Well, there's a bunch of reasons. For me it's mainly because the game features "traditional" zombies (somewhat slow moving, deadly in numbers etc.) unlike many modern "zombie"-games that feel more like battling aliens or mutants. I like the old traditional zombie style of the only weapon available to the zombies being their claws and teeths. This doesn't make the game boring when you play as the zombies though! You'll always have many possible ways to bring doom upon the humans. Hide in the darkness and strike when the time is right, or swarm the remaining survivors with your fellow zombies in an all-out zombie horde rush? it's all up to you!Playing as the survivors is also great fun! The game mainly has 2 gamemodes being played: "Objective" mode where you are put in a situation where you need to complete certain objectives to get the hell out of there before every single survivor has been eaten alive! The second gamemode is all about the survivors trying to stay alive at the location they're already at. After the survivors kill X amount of zombies, they win.... If they're not dead by then.Another thing I really like about the game is the atmosphere and the incredibly fun skill-"curve" in the game. When you've played for a while and become a skilled player, you will likely have learned the maps and weapons so well that you can take on more zombies than ever before! An example could be the very powerful weapon: The magnum. With this gun, a skilled player can take down 6 zombies with 6 bullets unlike the regular starting pistols that won't kill with 1 bullet to the head. As you learn more about the guns you'll also learn how to properly save ammo and when to use which weapon. important thing though: Be sure to share weapons with your teammates if all they have is a baseball bat and a pistol with 2 bullets! 												Most likely the BEST FREE ZOMBIE Game and HL2 MOD. Following right up, I decided to include the game's controls (and a little bit of trivia) in this review because people ask too many questions about this and it takes some time to memorize and get used to everything:BASIC CONTROLS: (Qwerty / English Keyboard)Mouse 1 - Attack / Shoot.Mouse 2 - Plant your IED / Push stuff (need to be empty handed as a survivor to do that, though); Zombies have a greater push force.Mouse 3 / Middle Mouse Button  (I find this a very useful control instead of the average V) - Voice chat (All-Talk).Y - Chat.U - Team chat (use it to contrive sneaky strategies with your team).WASD - Mobility.1/2/3/4/5 - Select specific items from your inventory. Scroll also works to change between items.E - Use things such as medkits / pills, doors, etc. (as survivor or sometimes depending on the map as zombie too) / Pick up your barricades (this won't reset their health though) or IED.Q - Switch to your previous weapon.R - Reload your weapon (you can always cancel the reload animation by switching quickly between weapons; this is useful because if there's incoming threat, you know what to do, don't reload, unload your entire d*mn clip on the zombies); Press it to turn the boards in your desired direction / As the Carrier, use the special ability: Roar (this activates a yellow aura around your body and makes zombies in your team, spawn closer to you and be able to see where you are from any point of the map).F  - Turn your flashlight on / off (flashlights do have a life, it lasts between 20-25 second but they regen when they're off). If you're a zombie, this key activates the zombie vision which enables you to see survivors clearly in the dark.G - Drop the current item you're holding.H - Put away / Holster your item (this is usually done so that you can push objects to barricade a place).L - Change from the old to the new zombie vision (the new one helps you see pitch black areas). Trust me, don't do it.SHIFT - Walk, as survivor (walking saves up your stamina). // Sprint, as zombie (use it wisely because this eats up your Feed-o-Meter bar) / When your bar is flashing red, activate Berserk mode to run and attack faster!Z - Taunt (no, this isn't TF2, if that's what you're thinking) / Cuss the zombies.X and C - Voice commands.V - Switch between ammo type.T - Drop the selected ammo type / or armor.B - Change the amount of ammo you want to drop (you can drop all the ammo, the whole magazine, half a magazine or a single round for a specific ammo type). There are 4 types of ammo. Pistol, shotgun, rifle and magnum.J - Pull out your Nokia and use it as a brick weapon (nah, just joking). Use it to detonate your IED (Improvised Explosive Device) by pressing M2, but be cautious, maintain your distance or take cover, otherwise you'll end up nuking yourself as well.O - Brings up the objectives list (if I were you I'd unbind that sh*t because it's really annoying since it's close to P).P - The key that gives a meaning to the game's title. Use it to PANIC. When you panic, adrenaline rushes in your veins and what this basically means is that you'll get a temporary speed boost but the con of this is that you drop all your things (weapons, ammo, etc. not the phone though, because Man can't survive without it) except the current item you're holding and armor (if you have it).CHARACTERS & ZOMBIES:By default, in the multiplayer tab, there are currently 6 playable characters. You can either choose which one you want or keep it at random. Each survivor's character starts with 100HP and doesn't have any advantage over another. Each character has their voices, lines and own zombie model. In the zombie team, there's a special bald, brawny and pale-white zombie called the Carrier (because he carries the virus; however, the community prefers calling him by Whitey / YT). This zombie has an additional 50HP than regular zombies (making a total of 250HP), moves a bit faster, deals greater damage (35HP instead of 25HP), has a special "Roar" ability and has a normal 10% chance of infecting a survivor (this value changes greatly in hardcore mode). Infected survivors appear green and will turn into a zombie in 30 to 60 seconds.There are currently 3 POPULAR TYPES OF GAMEMODES spread across various maps:- Maps that start with ZPS are survival maps (E.G.: Zps_Cinema);- Maps that start with ZPO are objective maps (Zpo_Biotec);& finally, for the last popular* gamemode we have maps that start with ZPH which stands for "hardcore" (Zph_Drinage).*There's also one more gamemode starting with ZPA which stands for "apocalypse" (E.G.: Zpa_Badbayou), but I won't be discussing it because it's boring and nobody plays that sh*t.- SURVIVAL maps are basically where the survivors make a last stand to eliminate all zombies. Survivors in this mode usually camp and barricade themselves in a room or hold a position in an open area (if things go bad, they have where to go). Zombies, however, need to be cautious because they have a limited amount of lives (they start with around 20 lives, give it a few more) and thus, need to strategize on the best way to get the survivors. For each kill you get, as a zombie in this gamemode, you earn one life for you and your teammates (if there are a few zombies left, this is crucial).- OBJECTIVE maps aren't really meant to be camped, just follow the instructions given to you by the map, do the objectives and try to help out your team (that includes holding a position temporarily / camping for a bit and guarding your teammates). Zombies have infinite lives in this gamemode (same for hardcore) and need to hinder the survivors from doing the objectives.- HARDCORE maps speak for themselves. These types of maps are mostly running away from zombies and platforming instead of trying to kill them, and surviving for 5 straight minutes. There's a very good reason why people don't mess around with zombies because all the weapons (except melee weapons) deal less damage (50%) to zombies (for example a magnum revolver takes 2 headshots to kill a normal zombie instead of 1) and the Carrier has a 100% chance of infecting people on hit; there can also be multiple Carriers in this mode (so, caution is advised).^ (I'm only referring to official and classic maps.) ^PROS:- Unique game;- Friendly and helpful community (except the griefers and people that watch you die).CONS:- Not many servers to play in (but there are always servers);- It crashes a lot (like, you can't play 2 maps in a row without it crashing once);- Easy to grief wherever there are doors to open.- Terrible hitboxes.Don't fret though, all of this should be fixed in the next update and there should be more servers running then. Speaking of the next update, there's gonna be some graphic and FPS improvements, since this game is going to finally run on multicores instead of only 1 core, now that Source SDK 2013 is going to be implemented and substituted by current Source SDK 2007.IMPORTANT MENTIONS:- Remember that, when playing this game, your team likes a teamplayer. Be sure to do something useful for your team (Example: share ammo, weapons and cover your teammates; attack together, as a zombie);- You should definitely try the magnum and the sledgehammer (1 hit in the head on all zombies except the Carrier; they deal 240 damage and 225, respectively);- Weapons and ammo have weights, take up different inventory spaces and have different recoils. Melee weapons have different ranges and knockbacks (sledgehammer having the strongest).Despite the cons, this game is still worth it.

A game that lends itself perfect for being played time and time again.  The Design With its impressive take on the zombie apocalypse, the game provides dark and creepy invironments, terrifying enemies and really immersive gameplay. The smooth and fairly simple controls gives the game a sort arcadic approach to a zombie game, mixing together survival horror with FPS action similar to what is seen in games like Quake and Half-Life. The game practically ensures that you're always playing the game, even after you die; You may spawn as an survivor at the start of the round but be killed and you get to face your former teammates as part of the zombie horde. The only timeout you'll face will be when zombies run out of lives on the survival gamemode which usually doesn't last more than a few minutes.  The Gameplay Each team requires different ways of thinking and playing the game; Survivors require more attention to scavenging and fatigue, zombies require more strategical thinking - knowing the right place and time to ambush the survivors to ensure the best outcome for your team. Zombies have to rely on their strength in numbers, like the survivors, but much more crucial to ensure a zombie win. Leading the zombie horder is the Carrier, referred to as 'Whitey', who has greater speed and attack damage than your regular zombie, while also possessing the ability to act as a beacon that guides you towards his location and lets you respawn close to him. Survivors have a large arsenal of weapons to use; Ranging from assualt rifles to kitchen equipment. In tough times, they can gain a temporarily stamina boost by 'panicking', allowing them a chance to flee the horde of zombies that have them overwhelmed. With excellent maps that allow for both high-paced actions but also incredible world building through their atmosphere and surroundings, with the randomness that occur from facing real players and their given strategy, each round is bound to be different. This variation in gameplay is only strengthen by the different gamemodes that the game has to offer such as survival, objective, assault and hardcore - each switching things up in their own respect.  The Community Looking past the amazing design of the game, what has kept me invested since 2009 when I started playing, is the amazing community. While a minority, mainly due to the previous years of no updates and the spread of content foreign to the orignal game design, there still exist a dozen of dedicated players who have been willing to support the game through years of no developer support, server attacks and infinite problems related to the game's outdated code and engine. Because of the effort of the community, a developer team has now been brought back and is in full swing on releasing the next, major update. A update that will see the game on a new engine, with depth added to the game's lore and characters, and a major overhaul of the original code - creating a solid fundation that can then be expanded upon. This game is a great example of what a community can do when its favorite game is abandoned by its developers because of financial and creative reasons. The power lies with the players, and the community has finally brought the game back to hopefully revive the game close to its former glory. If you're thinking 'Hey! This guy is a developer so his opinion is biased, then note that I only recently became one. My review is based upon 7 years of almost exclusively playing this game. I guess that lends itself for a bias, too, but it is also evidence of how great this game is!

												Just awesome! I wish the store page wasn't so badly outdated, but oh well. Anyway...This game seems simple, but it gets EXTREMELY complicated...The game modes are rather simple, there are more or less 6 modes:Survival- survivors need to euthanize all the zombies, which have limited lives.Objective- survivors complete tasks in order to escape or secure a locationTimed Survival- zpo maps where survivors need to last for a pre-determined amount of time.Annex- Both teams have endless lives, but fight over control points to winHardcore- Tougher zombies, there are higher infection rates, but survivors only need to live for 5 minutes to win.Deathrun- survivors need to complete a gauntlet, while zombie try to kill them with traps.Zombies have endlesss lives on most maps, and one goal: EAT YOUR FACE! The twist? They're all players, and these zombies can take a beating, and move at a decent pace, but the real problem is that they have REAL intelligence (most players anyway) and they WANT YOU DEAD! Because if you die, you turn into a zombie! Most rounds end in disaster because of this, but it makes Surviving all the more sweet. That and half the fun is when you are a zombie.Most players start rounds as a survivor, but a few will be zombies. And one lucky player will be the carrier, with an extra 50 HP, more damage per swipe, the ROAR ability, and the chance to infect survivors, who will soon turn into a friend. Best played like a zombie ninja. Hiding in the shadows, waiting for somebody to run by, then BAM! Eat their brains! Or drop on them from above, when someone is alone, or use the Roar to attract clueless zombies towards the last Human stronghold.Not like the survivors are pushovers though. You can out run zombies rather easily when you don't have anything, And there are a LOT of weapons. There are 9mm pistols, common, but rather handy if you are skilled with them, best used against lone Z's. Magnums, which blow off heads with 1 bullet. Shotguns, which can blow away Z's with bodyshots at close range, and Rifles, which are hard to use well, but slaughter zombies quickly.There's more! Explosives can kill whole hoards, Just be sure to cook your grenades first, and to try to lure as many zombies around a IED as possible. Throwing a IED around a corner and detonating it works wonders. Last, but no longer ussless, melee weapons are plentiful, varied, and powerful! They were overhauled August 2012, so they don't suck anymore. Matter of fact, they are VERY deadly in the right hands now! Frying Pan for the win.But don't grab too much crap, though. Everything weighs you down, and if you take everything, other people will likely die, and/or yell at you. Not to mention that your stamina will drain faster too, leaving you at risk when zombies are coming!I haven't even mentioned the music, maps, or anything else yet. The music is top notch, I can't do it justice with my words. The stock maps are great as well, It makes me sad that noobs prefer crappy Deathrun and silly Objective maps that are poorly crafted over the fantastic stock Survival maps. Not to say that the custom maps are all rubbish though. There are lots of great ones, and one of the current stock maps used to be a custom map.  The player models and view models are all decent, and the voice acting is surprisingly good.In short, if you played ZPS a long time ago, it's likely better now. Everything has been improved. Except the hilarious animations, which should never change. If you've never played it, you have missed a TON of wild fun. But there are still enough active servers to find a good match, and this game can be run on a toaster. So what are you waiting for? PANIC!Disclaimer: This is the option of somebody that has played more then 800 hours of ZPS, thus may be baised towards likeing said title. In game information is based on approximate the current status of title. Game CANNOT be run on a actual toaster. Toaster is a metaphor for a crappy computer. Servers are active as of Friday, May 20th, 2016 What a wall of text!

												A really nice game for killing boredom, it's pretty hard to get a hang of it at first, but when you do, it's really fun. There are no particular OP weapons, some are better if you're good at aiming, like the revolver, and some are better for you if you're a casual player who doesn't play much FPS games, like the shotguns or automatic weapons. A great part of this game is the necessity to work together, or everyone dies. It is also really fun to play with friends. Whoever created this game is a genius and needs to be rewarded.

The community is still very strong, with hundreds of players still each day.Some maps may be well balanced, or very survivor/zombie sided. Survivors can use various weapons including melee and explosives. Survivors can also use voice commands, "panic", flashlight, and many other actions. Zombies must attempt to kill all the survivors before running out of time, lives, or the survivors reaching a point. The carrier is basically the 'alpha zombie', having more strength, health, and the ability to infect and 'roar'.Modes you can play are objective mode (ZPO), survival mode (ZPS), team arena (ZPA), and hardcore (ZPH). There are also some deathrun maps. Some maps may require you to barricade. Some may require you to dodge blocks fired at you. Someone thinking it's a good idea to stop servers for god knows what reason. Competition? Self-amusement? Like I know, I didn't get involved in the controversy. Either way, it just wasn't fun seeing. I don't notice it too much anymore though. It's pretty subtle as I'm writing this.Second, foreign players. I mean, I don't mind if they can only talk with the language they grew up with... but sometimes during your time on a server, out of no where someone joins and starts talking in spanish, russian, and even portuguese. It's funny (No, not in a good way) because sometimes no one else is talking to them back and yet they still try to talk like that through the entire time they're on the server. Who knows, maybe if you're 100% new and considering playing with the game, you can simply try it and see if you can understand what I mean.

												My review on "Mar 12, 2013 @ 5:01pm"A "free" zombie game SO worth trying out! It's my first and favorite steam game and will always be! I love this game for the awesome players, simple but fun gameplay, and wonderful memories...with that I will always go back for more! ZOMBIE PANIC: SOURCE FTW!!!  :'DMy review on "Sept 7, 2016 @ 12:30am"My thoughts may sound different a little bit now. But I'm editing this because I don't want to sound bias (or simple minded) for all those lovely people looking at the steam page in reviews right now, so let me tell you some of the crap most players will have to deal with on the game.First off, ddos. Someone thinking it's a good idea to stop servers for god knows what reason. Competition? Self-amusement? Like I know, I didn't get involved in the controversy. Either way, it just wasn't fun seeing. I don't notice it too much anymore though. It's pretty subtle as I'm writing this.Second, foreign players. I mean, I don't mind if they can only talk with the language they grew up with... but sometimes during your time on a server, out of no where someone joins and starts talking in spanish, russian, and even portuguese. It's funny (No, not in a good way) because sometimes no one else is talking to them back and yet they still try to talk like that through the entire time they're on the server. So tell me, what's the point with talking on the mic if NO ONE else is having a conversation with you? It could be intentional, but why do that to people to begin with anyway?Third, teamwork. Nope. And I mean NOPE. It's more "I and my big gun" than team. Because big guns is the solution for winning for most players. Drop your pistol and run to a bigger gun to hog it all for yourself (especially the armor). "Someone is getting killed by whitey?" "Are they a walking gun I can use?" "No?" "Well, he can go die than." "Guns and camping are key!" God, I swear. Why don't some people get that more zombies = bad? You're just adding more zombies to deal with and making things harder for yourself. Unless they... ragequit.Which brings me to my fourth complaint. I ABSOLUTELY hate it when someone plays, dies, then quits. Why? You too good to be a zombie? I mean, this IS a zombie game. It's expected and fair, right? Seriously, that's like playing hide 'n seek and when you're found, you just say "I QUIT!". "You can't make me find those other guys like a well respected individual!" "I THOUGHT I WAS SUPPOSED TO WIN TO BEGIN WITH!" "Challenge is a hell no in my book!" "Have fun finding them by yourself!" It's just very immature. Though despite all of these reasons -DESPITE them all... I always come back. Yes, I still recommend the game after these points because this game has the charm to make me want to return to enjoy the good fun stuff on it, being the only game that has the potential to do so for me... it really means a lot if I got past those points. I know I'm not the only one. There are still developers trying to make it better and even have updates. Who knows, maybe if you're 100% new and considering playing with the game, you can simply try it and see if you can understand what I mean.

												A well-made source mod that offers a type of gameplay not experienced in other zombie games.The game is split up into two primary game modes: survival and objective maps. Objective maps give a group of players a linear set of objectives that take players along a map. The objectives in each map aren't all that repetitive and have you completing a variety of tasks that lead you to new parts of the map. This gametype is impossible to solo and some maps demand lots of communication. Survival mode scatters players throughout a map and has them survive either until all the zombies have been killed or the timer runs out. Since there is no map progression, players must hunker down, set up barricades and gather supplies in order to survive.ZPS was made with teamwork in mind. From my experience, the surivor win-rate in surival mode is about 20-30% and about 5-20% in objective maps. Once a survivor dies they become a zombie, so if you lose too many of your teammates too fast, you will have a harder time as the map progresses. Everything you carry (down to each bullet) has weight that noticably impacts your movement speed and available run energy. People that hoard supplies are not only easy prey for zombies, they are also easily noticable by teammates which will rightfully give you a hard time. Every gun also requires its cooresponding type of ammunition; if your friend runs out of ammo for his AK47, you can toss him a magazine of rifle ammo if you got any.Being a source engine game, ZPS enjoys new maps and content from the modding community. Although it's not what it was years ago, there's still plenty of maps that were created for you to enjoy now. Just don't expect many more new maps in the future unless you're willing to make them.Overall, I recommend this game to anyone after a more team-based, realistic zombie-survival experience.

												I got exhausted on it, but I still think it's a very good mod. ZP:S is a more relaxing and fun-like approach on the numerous available zombie apocalypse multiplayer games. Compared to other FPS it's pacing is a bit slower; sometimes things get a bit messy, but often that leads to humorous situations. Generally you can get quite many laughs out of it.It's PvP only, humans control the survivors and zombies. You choose your team before a round starts. Should no player/not enough players (there is a ratio and autoteam balance) join either team some are assigned randomly. Ammo is relatively scarce, but respawns on the maps after a while, which eventually enables more skilled humans to survive for prolonged times. Luckily there is fatigue, so they cannot run forever. There are several melee weapons, which allow ammo conservation, but it's very risky since (depending on the server settings) either the "carrier" or regular zombies have a chance of infecting you on hit. The first player to join the zombie team becomes the "carrier" - he has more health, can infect people by default and can activate a "roar" which makes him glow throw walls for his teammates so they can see his location and group up on him as a kind of leader. If supported/respected by the map designers zombies also spawn near the carrier when his roar is active, practically turning him into a mobile spawn point. Sadly a great mass of custom maps (many servers are running with them) are not supporting this feature properly. Infected people appear in green color to the zombies. To human teammates it is hidden. Infected cannot drop or pick up items any longer. There are HUD indicators telling you about your infection. Seconds before turning friendly fire is enabled for the infected, which is why - just in case - some survivors always walk around taking melee swings at teammates that took damage from the zombies. On some servers there are pills that can cure infection, though I believe this is not a default setting of this game. In most modes when you die as a survivor you are switching over to the zombie team, that is why you want to keep your infection hidden to your (as of now still) allied survivor mates, just to wait behind them and get some of them when you are turning.You can extensively barricade yourself in this game. You can put up wooden planks in two different sizes freely on flat surfaces. And you can push around furniture items thanks to the Source engine. This allows for some pretty nasty and interesting fortification jobs. For example you put up two planks across a door and then push couches in front of the planks. Or you do it the other way around. Whatever works best, really. Provided the survivors do the barricading well enough, and keep the zombies long enough at distance, this can be decisive to either win or lose a round. Zombies can push things with the right mouse button back though, combined with "sprinting" (lunging) they do a "super push" tossing furniture across whole rooms and killing some humans with the power of physics, eventually. Pretty hilarious when you manage to pull off such spectacular kills. There are four modes:Survival: Zombies have a shared pool of limited lives. If all zombies die or if a certain time has passed without the zombies having killed all humans the survivors win.Objective: Zombies have unlimited lives. Humans traverse the maps, handle objects, overcome obstacles and get extracted in some way.Hardcore: Zombies spawn directly behind the humans ("Escape"/"Deathrun"/"Traps" maps). The humans must flee from them and survive for some time. The zombies have additional numbers of "carriers" and take more damage.ZPA: Zombies and humans have unlimited lives (in the other modes once a human dies he is assigned to the zombie team, in ZPA he respawns as a human again). There are control points appearing in random spots of the map, both teams are fighting for them, these points generate score points and spawn supplies should survivors capture them. The team with most score points wins, or the zombies do when they manage to capture the central point of the humans.Teamplay is advised to properly and quickly barricade defensive areas and organize guns and ammo, just as zombies need to organize somewhat since their team plays by the rule "Strength in numbers". Zombies attacking survivors alone are easy pickings, while a horde can absorb more bullets and eventually find a moment to slip through and take some human down. Sadly to me the community looks a bit degenerated. There are always servers and people playing, but not extraordinary many, at some point you run into the same folks over and over again, and numerous play in sort of an elitist way ignoring common sense, the well-being of their teammates and the goals of the often objective-based game modes, doing everything but not what they are supposed to. Eventually they will actively grief and help the other team by - for example - hording ammo without using it or destroying your barricades without having any reason to. Or people who die as survivors and are switched to the zombie team simply go afk because they don't like playing as zombies. To add to it I haven't come across too many properly administrated servers - often there aren't any admins, they don't care or they abuse their power.The game is updated sometimes, but it doesn't like look as if there is much more to be added. That may change because the developers seem to be working both at updating ZP:S and on a new title called "Contagion". ZP:S is pretty fine as it is and there is a lot of custom content. Most problems I see with it emerge from the players, not from the game itself.

Source is a co-op oriented Survivor vs Zombie multi-player survival horror mod.In the mod, players can generally participate in timed matches against the opposite team, or the humans try to solve objective-based missions. One thing that really separates Zombie Panic! from Left 4 Dead is that if you die, you will become a zombie. To prevent yourself from going the way of the undead, you will have to arm yourself with shotguns, rifles, explosives and more. In addition to a lot of last man (or zombie) type matches, as previously mentioned, there are also objective-based scenarios. In these modes, humans will often have to find resources like wood boards or gas canisters, turn cranks and knobs, or do a combination of both. Zombie Panic! Source is an overall good-looking mod with some minor clipping issues.So if you are looking for another interesting take on the oncoming zombie apocalypse, Zombie Panic! I was addicted to it for the day, as it had interesting things like building barricades, placing blanks of wood over walls. And you could use Source engine for the great good (and the great evil for zombies) to barricade the stairs and doors with actual prop using dem physics.Then I realized that it sucked, just like Zombie Horde for Doom Skulltag. Zombies just walk around, tanking everything, while humans camp on high ground and shoot everything or run around in open ground and hunt zombies, who are just too slow for that. Tons of weapons and ammo, hilarity ensues. You win as zombies only because some humans aren't good enough or get too bored.Didn't take long time to realize that these maps are like cp_orange in TF2. Something awful that attracts lots of people for weird reasons.Thankfully, there was server running stock and custom objective-based maps as well, so I was addicted for another day. All yay humans not being able to just camp and having to move and share ammunition.Then I still realized that it didn't fall too far from Zombie Horde either. Zombies can ambush, but they still have to tank and dance around while being shot. They still can win if there is too many.  While humans fight cheapness with cheapness by having revolver than one-shots them all into head. As usual with PvP zombie games with no AI zombies, it starts with humans easily doing everything and most likely win unless they make some mistake and it all steamrolls down the hill, usually.And don't know, maybe I am too spoiled by Zombie Horde taking over Doom Skulltag, but this one felt uninspired and kinda samey.

												It takes a lot to make a good zombie gameHaving player controlled zombies isn't the way forwardLeft 4 Dead gave you special infected; zombies that could pack a punch if the player behind it had some skill. But in this, the undead are slow with the stupidest sprint mechanic imaginable. So joining a game late and being forced onto the zombie team just isn't fun.Playing the survivors is just pitiful.Melee weapons seem to have no punch behind them, and the same can be said for firearms. I get absolutely no feedback on whether the shot hit or missed because the undead don't flinch almost at all. The ammo drop system is probably the most complex and easily forgettable I have encountered in my gaming life.Maps, especially survival maps, are pain-stakingly repeatetive. Survivors always hold up in the same space. I feel utterly dumbstruck when I'm in a garage with one easily defended entrance and two garage doors for quick escapes, ammunition and weapons littering the floor and anyone else who spawned with me storms off to the meta position as if miffed by how the spawn system dared not spawn them inside the ♥♥♥♥ing top floor of that house (Yes, cabin, you overused ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, I'm looking at you).Now, I'm not going to complain too much about the graphics, considering their age and how I sort of like these kinds of graphics. What I am going to complain about is how bored I got while playing it. As a survivor, I'm waiting in the meta spot (Because standing anywhere else is essentially suicide) waiting for a zombie to come clear into view without the possibilty of missing with the pistol everyone gets, before it is immediatley shot by some other guy who has three firearms strapped to his back. Once the undead storm us, we all die and those who run tire eventually and are caught by the infected. As a zombie I spend half the time knocking down the door before A: The objective changes and their's a brand new door I can keep bashing my head against until it breaks out of pity or B: I open it and am turned into a collander. I run out of sprint easily as I try to get to the survivors before they move on, and can't catch up to them because they used that ♥♥♥♥ing panic move.I understand that this game is an 8 year-old community mod and making zomies human controlled may have been a good way of not writing the seven-thousand lines of programming for a single step of an AI controlled one, and it gives dead players something to do other than twiddling their thumbs, but it's very hard to do without causing a complete imbalance.
